intro: Psychotria phaneroloma var. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental appeal and potential pharmacological properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
